about.title: Nurturing Classical Arts with Authenticity
about.description1: At Shreem Natyalaya, we preserve and celebrate the timeless beauty of classical Indian arts through traditional guru-shishya parampara. Every student receives personalized guidance, deep cultural insights, and a nurturing environment to grow both as an artist and as an individual.
about.description2: We believe that classical arts are more than techniques—they are a journey into India's rich spiritual and cultural heritage, cultivating discipline, devotion, and a lifelong connection to our traditions.
about.description3: Through disciplined practice and devotion to the art form, we help students develop not just technical skills, but also a profound connection to the spiritual and cultural heritage of India.

aboutGuru.pageSubtitle: A personal journey of passion and dedication to classical arts
aboutGuru.intro1Rest: , a classical dance and music academy dedicated to preserving and sharing the beauty of traditional Indian arts.
aboutGuru.intro2: My journey in classical arts has been deeply rooted in tradition, discipline, and devotion. Through years of dedicated practice and teaching, I have developed a strong foundation in music and movement, guided by the Guru–Shishya Parampara. This journey has shaped my understanding of rhythm, expression, and spiritual connection, which I passionately pass on to every student I teach.
aboutGuru.intro3Rest: , I run this institution with energy, commitment, and a deep sense of responsibility. Every student who walks through our doors becomes part of my artistic family.
aboutGuru.learningJourneySubtitle: How family tradition shaped my artistic foundation
aboutGuru.training1Rest: , who instilled in me not just technique, but a deep reverence for these art forms
aboutGuru.training2Rest: , whose musical wisdom shaped my understanding of melody and rhythm
aboutGuru.training3: My artistic foundation was built within my family—where tradition was lived, not just taught

aboutGuru.approach2: I run Shreem Natyalaya with strong enthusiasm, continuous effort, and unwavering dedication
aboutGuru.approach3: I bring the same discipline and systematic thinking from my IT career into my teaching methodology

aboutGuru.philosophy2: I believe that every student's growth, discipline, and confidence matters equally
aboutGuru.philosophy3: I am personally invested in my students' artistic journey—celebrating their progress and guiding them through challenges

aboutGuru.milestonesSubtitle: A journey marked by dedication, discipline, and artistic excellence
aboutGuru.salangaiDesc: A sacred ceremony marking the beginning of my formal Bharatanatyam training, where I received my first ghungroos (ankle bells) with blessings from my Athai.
aboutGuru.arangetramDesc: My debut solo performance—a defining moment in my Bharatanatyam journey. This prestigious milestone represents years of dedicated training and marks my transition from student to performing artist.
aboutGuru.award1Desc: Honored for Graceful Stage Performance and Young Choreographic Excellence
aboutGuru.award2Subtitle: Young achiever award for performing continously for 2 hours
aboutGuru.award2Desc: Title & Awards received in the hands of "Kalaimamani" Valaiyapatti
aboutGuru.district1Desc: Secured Second Place at the District Level
aboutGuru.district3Title: Tamil Nadu State level Veena Competition (School-level)
aboutGuru.district3Desc: Received first prize from "Veena" E. Gayathri ma'am
aboutGuru.journeySubtitle: The milestones that led me to establish this academy
aboutGuru.myEarlyDesc: I began learning classical dance and music from my family. My Athai taught me Bharatanatyam and Veena, while my father guided me in Keyboard. I started learning at Sri Raghavendra Natyalaya - Perungalathur from 2002 onwards. These early years built my artistic foundation.
aboutGuru.asststantDirectorDesc: I worked as a part-time Assistant Director of Sri Raghavendra Natyalaya, where I performed numerous temple cultural events with my students. This experience strengthened my passion for sharing classical arts and teaching.
aboutGuru.director: I Became Director of Sri Raghavendra Natyalaya
aboutGuru.directorDescription: I became the Director of Sri Raghavendra Natyalaya, leading the academy and organizing cultural events. This role deepened my commitment to preserving and teaching classical arts.During this time, I learned choreography and arranged temple events with orchestra, deepening my understanding of classical arts.
aboutGuru.advancedTrainingDesc: I pursued advanced training from "H.N.Nandhini Suresh" for Nattuvangam.
aboutGuru.foundedDesc: I founded Shreem Natyalaya in 2025 with the vision of providing authentic classical arts education. Today, I personally teach and mentor every student with dedication, discipline, and care, ensuring strong foundations in tradition and artistry.

aboutGuru.commitmentPoint1: When you entrust your child to Shreem Natyalaya, you're not just enrolling them in classes— you're welcoming them into a space where I personally ensure their growth, confidence, and love for classical arts.
aboutGuru.commitmentPoint2: I am here not just as a teacher, but as a mentor who genuinely cares about each student's journey. I bring the same passion my family instilled in me, and I promise to nurture that same passion in your children.
aboutGuru.commitmentPoint3: Let's preserve this beautiful tradition together.

philosophy.title: Teaching Philosophy
philosophy.description: At Shreem Natyalaya, we believe in the traditional Guru-Shishya Parampara, where knowledge is passed down with dedication, discipline, and devotion. Our approach combines rigorous training with individual attention, ensuring each student develops both technical excellence and artistic expression.
